note.p: Baptism: Monken Hadley, Middlesex, England, Europe (26 August 1647)
Death: His house in Westminster, London, England, Europe (29 November 1711)
Burial Place: Sapperton, Gloucestershire, England, Europe (12 December 1711)
Education: St Edmund's Hall, Oxford (admitted 1663); Lincoln's Inn (admitted 1661)

Career: Called to the Bar (1668) but did not practise; Deputy Receiver-General of Law Duties (1671-1672), Receiver-General (1672-1673), Comptroller (1673-1679); Commissioner for Assessment for Gloucestershire (1673-1680, 1689-1690); Deputy-Lieutenant for Gloucestershire (1683-1688); MP for Cirencester (1680-1681), Gloucestershire (1684-1685)
Committee appointment include: Nominated for Committee for improving the English language (1664)
Other RSActivity: Expelled due to non-payment of arrears.
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; Henning; ODNB

Notes: Although Hunter and Henning say that it was this Atkyns who was a Fellow, he was only 17 in 1664; his father seems a more likely candidate. Journal Book implies it was Sir Robert Jr who was elected but the elder Sir Robert's father, Sir Edward, was still alive at the time.
